intro: Triumfetta heterophylla, commonly known as the variable triumfetta, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that vary in shape depending on environmental conditions. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, round, fleshy fruits that are often eaten by birds and other animals. It is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in savannas, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
